trans-unit.source: Renders the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"></xref> children within the specified 2D viewport bounds.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual> is a 2D Visual with 3D children.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual> provides necessary infrastructure for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Viewport3D> element.
Most users will want to use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Viewport3D> element.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Effects.BitmapEffect"></xref> applied to the Viewport3DVisual.
Bitmap effects are software-rendered.
Any object that applies an effect will also be rendered in software.
Bitmap effects should not be applied to large visuals or animations as this can degrade performance.
BitmapEffect applied to the Viewport3DVisual.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Effects.BitmapEffectInput"></xref> applied to the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual"></xref>.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.Effects.BitmapEffectInput> applies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Effects.BitmapEffect> given in the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual.BitmapEffect%2A> property to a specified region of the visual object.
Bitmap effects are software-rendered.
Any object that applies an effect will also be rendered in software.
Bitmap effects should not be applied to large visuals or animations as this can degrade performance.
BitmapEffectInput applied to the Viewport3DVisual.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Camera"></xref> used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual"></xref>.
Camera used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual.Camera"></xref> dependency property.
Gets a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"></xref> objects contained by <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual"></xref>.
Collection of the objects contained by the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual"></xref>.
Gets or sets the clipping region of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual"></xref>.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> that defines the clipping area.
Gets the bounding box for the contents of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual"></xref>.
<xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that defines the bounding box.

Gets the union of all of the content bounding boxes for all of the descendants of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual"></xref>, but not including the contents of the Viewport3DVisual.
<xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that defines the union.

Initiate a hit test on the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual"></xref> by using the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.HitTestFilterCallback"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.HitTestResultCallback"></xref> objects.
The `filterCallback` parameter can be null, in which case, it is ignored.
If `filterCallback` is not a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), it is invoked before `resultCallback`.
Value of type HitTestFilterCallback.
Value of type HitTestResultCallback.
Value of type <xref href="System.Windows.Media.HitTestParameters"></xref>.
Returns the top-most visual object of a hit test performed at a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref>.
Point against which to hit test.
The hit test result of the visual returned as a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.HitTestResult"></xref> type.
Gets or sets the offset value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual"></xref>.
<xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> that represents the offset value of the Viewport3DVisual.
Gets or sets the opacity of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual"></xref>.
The value of the Opacity property is expressed as a value between 0 and 1, specifying a range from fully transparent to fully opaque.
A value of 0 indicates that the Opacity is completely transparent, while a value of 1 indicates that the Opacity is completely opaque.
A value 0.5 would indicate the Opacity is 50% opaque, a value of 0.725 would indicate the Opacity is 72.5% opaque, and so on.
Values less than 0 are treated as 0, while values greater than 1 are treated as 1.
Gets or sets the opacity mask value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual"></xref>.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Brush"></xref> that represents the opacity mask value of the Viewport3DVisual.
Gets the parent <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> for the Viewport3DVisual.
Visual parent of the Viewport3DVisual.
Gets or sets the transform value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual"></xref>.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Transform"></xref> applied to the Viewport3DVisual.
Gets or sets the rectangle in which the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual"></xref> will be rendered.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
Rectangle in which the contents of the Viewport3D will be rendered.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual.Viewport"></xref> dependency property.
